message_1: Suppose you are the manager of a company considering two different projects. The first project has a 70% chance of earning a profit of $50,000 and a 30% chance of earning nothing. The second project has a 40% chance of earning a profit of $100,000 and a 60% chance of losing $20,000. However, your employees are paid based on the project they work on and will receive $5,000 for working on the first project and $10,000 for working on the second project. If you want to maximize the total profit for your company, which project should you choose and why?

Expected profit = $30,000
